title: Cycling Plus November issue on sale now! Subscribe and receive a free Lezyne light set worth £55
content:
The latest Cycling Plus is a bumper edition complete with a waterproof cycling wallet and a 52-page adventure riding guide for every reader.

That bonus adventure guide has everything you need to plan big rides and bikepacking trips, both on-road and off, in 2021 and beyond. You’ll find expert tips on kit, bikes, routes and events.

In the main magazine, we run the rule over the latest generation of aluminium road bikes, with four of the best metal rides put through their paces.

Plus, if you subscribe to Cycling Plus you’ll receive a free Lezyne light set worth £55.

New gear

Our Upgrade section includes a buyer’s guide to power meters, plus we take a look at Zipp’s 353 NSW wheels, the Met Manta MIPS helmet, Gaerne’s Carbon G.STL shoes and much more.

There are also first-ride reviews of two new e-gravel bikes from GT and Kinesis, plus first ride reviews of VanMoof’s S3 urban ebike and the latest iteration of the legendary Genesis Tour de Fer.

Power struggle

As for features, we put FTP under the microscope and investigate whether we can learn to use the popular training metric any better.

We also shake a bucket with top cycling fundraisers and learn how they maximise funds, and head to Sweden for three days of penny-farthing racing.

Big Ride: Cornwall

In the Big Ride spot, Nick Busca explores the ferocious hills close to his new home in Bude, Cornwall.

In our Training Zone section, we look at how your sense of smell might unlock endurance gains, the best big ride breakfast recipes and how Christina MacKenzie broke the Land’s End to John o’Groats record. We also profile the Mallorca 312 gran fondo.

This issue’s Masterclass, meanwhile, unlocks the secrets of aerodynamics, revealing the changes you can make to go faster.

Adventure guide

We’ve got a supplement, too. A big one – 52 pages – dedicated to the world of adventure and gravel, as we delve into the best bikes, equipment, routes and events.

Subscription offer

Subscribe to Cycling Plus magazine today and you’ll get a Lezyne light set worth £55 – perfect for winter.

Whether you’re looking at investing in a new bike, trying a different kind of cycling or searching for new gear to make those days on the road more comfortable, Cycling Plus is the magazine for you.

You’ll find inspiring features from across the UK and around the world on every page, plus interviews with the movers and shakers in cycling.

Remember, subscribe today and you’ll receive a free Lezyne light setup. You’ll also save 30% on the shop price.

Otherwise, check out the Cycling Plus Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts for all of the latest news from the magazine team.
